35/*!
36 \class QListView
37
38 \brief The QListView class provides a list or icon view onto a model.
39
40 \ingroup model-view
41 \ingroup advanced
42 \inmodule QtWidgets
43
44 \image windows-listview.png
45
46 A QListView presents items stored in a model, either as a simple
47 non-hierarchical list, or as a collection of icons. This class is used
48 to provide lists and icon views that were previously provided by the
49 \c QListBox and \c QIconView classes, but using the more flexible
50 approach provided by Qt's model/view architecture.
51
52 The QListView class is one of the \l{Model/View Classes}
53 and is part of Qt's \l{Model/View Programming}{model/view framework}.
54
55 This view does not display horizontal or vertical headers; to display
56 a list of items with a horizontal header, use QTreeView instead.
57
58 QListView implements the interfaces defined by the
59 QAbstractItemView class to allow it to display data provided by
60 models derived from the QAbstractItemModel class.
61
62 Items in a list view can be displayed using one of two view modes:
63 In \l ListMode, the items are displayed in the form of a simple list;
64 in \l IconMode, the list view takes the form of an \e{icon view} in
65 which the items are displayed with icons like files in a file manager.
66 By default, the list view is in \l ListMode. To change the view mode,
67 use the setViewMode() function, and to determine the current view mode,
68 use viewMode().
69
70 Items in these views are laid out in the direction specified by the
71 flow() of the list view. The items may be fixed in place, or allowed
72 to move, depending on the view's movement() state.
73
74 If the items in the model cannot be completely laid out in the
75 direction of flow, they can be wrapped at the boundary of the view
76 widget; this depends on isWrapping(). This property is useful when the
77 items are being represented by an icon view.
78
79 The resizeMode() and layoutMode() govern how and when the items are
80 laid out. Items are spaced according to their spacing(), and can exist
81 within a notional grid of size specified by gridSize(). The items can
82 be rendered as large or small icons depending on their iconSize().
83
84 \section1 Improving Performance
85
86 It is possible to give the view hints about the data it is handling in order
87 to improve its performance when displaying large numbers of items. One approach
88 that can be taken for views that are intended to display items with equal sizes
89 is to set the \l uniformItemSizes property to true.
90
91 \sa {View Classes}, {Item Views Puzzle Example}, QTreeView, QTableView, QListWidget
92*/
93
94/*!
95 \enum QListView::ViewMode
96
97 \value ListMode The items are laid out using TopToBottom flow, with Small size and Static movement
98 \value IconMode The items are laid out using LeftToRight flow, with Large size and Free movement
99*/
100
101/*!
102 \enum QListView::Movement
103
104 \value Static The items cannot be moved by the user.
105 \value Free The items can be moved freely by the user.
106 \value Snap The items snap to the specified grid when moved; see
107 setGridSize().
108*/
109
110/*!
111 \enum QListView::Flow
112
113 \value LeftToRight The items are laid out in the view from the left
114 to the right.
115 \value TopToBottom The items are laid out in the view from the top
116 to the bottom.
117*/
118
119/*!
120 \enum QListView::ResizeMode
121
122 \value Fixed The items will only be laid out the first time the view is shown.
123 \value Adjust The items will be laid out every time the view is resized.
124*/
125
126/*!
127 \enum QListView::LayoutMode
128
129 \value SinglePass The items are laid out all at once.
130 \value Batched The items are laid out in batches of \l batchSize items.
131 \sa batchSize
132*/
133
134/*!
135 \since 4.2
136 \fn void QListView::indexesMoved(const QModelIndexList &indexes)
137
138 This signal is emitted when the specified \a indexes are moved in the view.
139*/
140
141/*!
142 Creates a new QListView with the given \a parent to view a model.
143 Use setModel() to set the model.
144*/
145QListView::QListView(QWidget *parent)
146 : QAbstractItemView(*new QListViewPrivate, parent)
147{
148 setViewMode(ListMode);
149 setSelectionMode(SingleSelection);
150 setAttribute(Qt::WA_MacShowFocusRect);
151 Q_D(QListView); // We rely on a qobject_cast for PM_DefaultFrameWidth to change
152 d->updateStyledFrameWidths(); // hence we have to force an update now that the object has been constructed
153}
154
155/*!
156 \internal
157*/
158QListView::QListView(QListViewPrivate &dd, QWidget *parent)
159 : QAbstractItemView(dd, parent)
160{
161 setViewMode(ListMode);
162 setSelectionMode(SingleSelection);
163 setAttribute(Qt::WA_MacShowFocusRect);
164 Q_D(QListView); // We rely on a qobject_cast for PM_DefaultFrameWidth to change
165 d->updateStyledFrameWidths(); // hence we have to force an update now that the object has been constructed
166}

173}

175/*!
176 \property QListView::movement
177 \brief whether the items can be moved freely, are snapped to a
178 grid, or cannot be moved at all.
179
180 This property determines how the user can move the items in the
181 view. \l Static means that the items can't be moved by the user.
182 \l Free means that the user can drag and drop the items to any
183 position in the view. \l Snap means that the user can drag and
184 drop the items, but only to the positions in a notional grid
185 signified by the gridSize property.
186
187 Setting this property when the view is visible will cause the
188 items to be laid out again.
189
190 By default, this property is set to \l Static.
191
192 \sa gridSize, resizeMode, viewMode
193*/
194void QListView::setMovement(Movement movement)
195{
196 Q_D(QListView);
197 d->modeProperties |= uint(QListViewPrivate::Movement);
198 d->movement = movement;
199
200#if QT_CONFIG(draganddrop)
201 bool movable = (movement != Static);
202 setDragEnabled(movable);
203 d->viewport->setAcceptDrops(movable);
204#endif
205 d->doDelayedItemsLayout();
206}
207
208QListView::Movement QListView::movement() const
209{
210 Q_D(const QListView);
211 return d->movement;
212}
213
214/*!
215 \property QListView::flow
216 \brief which direction the items layout should flow.
217
218 If this property is \l LeftToRight, the items will be laid out left
219 to right. If the \l isWrapping property is \c true, the layout will wrap
220 when it reaches the right side of the visible area. If this
221 property is \l TopToBottom, the items will be laid out from the top
222 of the visible area, wrapping when it reaches the bottom.
223
224 Setting this property when the view is visible will cause the
225 items to be laid out again.
226
227 By default, this property is set to \l TopToBottom.
228
229 \sa viewMode
230*/
231void QListView::setFlow(Flow flow)
232{
233 Q_D(QListView);
234 d->modeProperties |= uint(QListViewPrivate::Flow);
235 d->flow = flow;
236 d->doDelayedItemsLayout();
237}
238
239QListView::Flow QListView::flow() const
240{
241 Q_D(const QListView);
242 return d->flow;
243}
244
245/*!
246 \property QListView::isWrapping
247 \brief whether the items layout should wrap.
248
249 This property holds whether the layout should wrap when there is
250 no more space in the visible area. The point at which the layout wraps
251 depends on the \l flow property.
252
253 Setting this property when the view is visible will cause the
254 items to be laid out again.
255
256 By default, this property is \c false.
257
258 \sa viewMode
259*/
260void QListView::setWrapping(bool enable)
261{
262 Q_D(QListView);
263 d->modeProperties |= uint(QListViewPrivate::Wrap);
264 d->setWrapping(enable);
265 d->doDelayedItemsLayout();
266}
267
268bool QListView::isWrapping() const
269{
270 Q_D(const QListView);
271 return d->isWrapping();
272}

274/*!
275 \property QListView::resizeMode
276 \brief whether the items are laid out again when the view is resized.
277
278 If this property is \l Adjust, the items will be laid out again
279 when the view is resized. If the value is \l Fixed, the items will
280 not be laid out when the view is resized.
281
282 By default, this property is set to \l Fixed.
283
284 \sa movement, gridSize, viewMode
285*/
286void QListView::setResizeMode(ResizeMode mode)
287{
288 Q_D(QListView);
289 d->modeProperties |= uint(QListViewPrivate::ResizeMode);
290 d->resizeMode = mode;
291}
292
293QListView::ResizeMode QListView::resizeMode() const
294{
295 Q_D(const QListView);
296 return d->resizeMode;
297}

299/*!
300 \property QListView::layoutMode
301 \brief determines whether the layout of items should happen immediately or be delayed.
302
303 This property holds the layout mode for the items. When the mode
304 is \l SinglePass (the default), the items are laid out all in one go.
305 When the mode is \l Batched, the items are laid out in batches of \l batchSize
306 items, while processing events. This makes it possible to
307 instantly view and interact with the visible items while the rest
308 are being laid out.
309
310 \sa viewMode
311*/
312void QListView::setLayoutMode(LayoutMode mode)
313{
314 Q_D(QListView);
315 d->layoutMode = mode;
316}
317
318QListView::LayoutMode QListView::layoutMode() const
319{
320 Q_D(const QListView);
321 return d->layoutMode;
322}
323
324/*!
325 \property QListView::spacing
326 \brief the space around the items in the layout
327
328 This property is the size of the empty space that is padded around
329 an item in the layout.
330
331 Setting this property when the view is visible will cause the
332 items to be laid out again.
333
334 By default, this property contains a value of 0.
335
336 \sa viewMode
337*/
338void QListView::setSpacing(int space)
339{
340 Q_D(QListView);
341 d->modeProperties |= uint(QListViewPrivate::Spacing);
342 d->setSpacing(space);
343 d->doDelayedItemsLayout();
344}
345
346int QListView::spacing() const
347{
348 Q_D(const QListView);
349 return d->spacing();
350}

352/*!
353 \property QListView::batchSize
354 \brief the number of items laid out in each batch if \l layoutMode is
355 set to \l Batched
356
357 The default value is 100.
358
359 \since 4.2
360*/
361
362void QListView::setBatchSize(int batchSize)
363{
364 Q_D(QListView);
365 if (Q_UNLIKELY(batchSize <= 0)) {
366 qWarning(msg: "Invalid batchSize (%d)", batchSize);
367 return;
368 }
369 d->batchSize = batchSize;
370}
371
372int QListView::batchSize() const
373{
374 Q_D(const QListView);
375 return d->batchSize;
376}

378/*!
379 \property QListView::gridSize
380 \brief the size of the layout grid
381
382 This property is the size of the grid in which the items are laid
383 out. The default is an empty size which means that there is no
384 grid and the layout is not done in a grid. Setting this property
385 to a non-empty size switches on the grid layout. (When a grid
386 layout is in force the \l spacing property is ignored.)
387
388 Setting this property when the view is visible will cause the
389 items to be laid out again.
390
391 \sa viewMode
392*/
393void QListView::setGridSize(const QSize &size)
394{
395 Q_D(QListView);
396 d->modeProperties |= uint(QListViewPrivate::GridSize);
397 d->setGridSize(size);
398 d->doDelayedItemsLayout();
399}
400
401QSize QListView::gridSize() const
402{
403 Q_D(const QListView);
404 return d->gridSize();
405}
406
407/*!
408 \property QListView::viewMode
409 \brief the view mode of the QListView.
410
411 This property will change the other unset properties to conform
412 with the set view mode. QListView-specific properties that have already been set
413 will not be changed, unless clearPropertyFlags() has been called.
414
415 Setting the view mode will enable or disable drag and drop based on the
416 selected movement. For ListMode, the default movement is \l Static
417 (drag and drop disabled); for IconMode, the default movement is
418 \l Free (drag and drop enabled).
419
420 \sa isWrapping, spacing, gridSize, flow, movement, resizeMode
421*/
422void QListView::setViewMode(ViewMode mode)
423{
424 Q_D(QListView);
425 if (d->commonListView && d->viewMode == mode)
426 return;
427 d->viewMode = mode;
428
429 delete d->commonListView;
430 if (mode == ListMode) {
431 d->commonListView = new QListModeViewBase(this, d);
432 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::Wrap))
433 d->setWrapping(false);
434 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::Spacing))
435 d->setSpacing(0);
436 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::GridSize))
437 d->setGridSize(QSize());
438 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::Flow))
439 d->flow = TopToBottom;
440 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::Movement))
441 d->movement = Static;
442 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::ResizeMode))
443 d->resizeMode = Fixed;
444 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::SelectionRectVisible))
445 d->showElasticBand = false;
446 } else {
447 d->commonListView = new QIconModeViewBase(this, d);
448 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::Wrap))
449 d->setWrapping(true);
450 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::Spacing))
451 d->setSpacing(0);
452 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::GridSize))
453 d->setGridSize(QSize());
454 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::Flow))
455 d->flow = LeftToRight;
456 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::Movement))
457 d->movement = Free;
458 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::ResizeMode))
459 d->resizeMode = Fixed;
460 if (!(d->modeProperties & QListViewPrivate::SelectionRectVisible))
461 d->showElasticBand = true;
462 }
463
464#if QT_CONFIG(draganddrop)
465 bool movable = (d->movement != Static);
466 setDragEnabled(movable);
467 setAcceptDrops(movable);
468#endif
469 d->clear();
470 d->doDelayedItemsLayout();
471}
472
473QListView::ViewMode QListView::viewMode() const
474{
475 Q_D(const QListView);
476 return d->viewMode;
477}
478
479/*!
480 Clears the QListView-specific property flags. See \l{viewMode}.
481
482 Properties inherited from QAbstractItemView are not covered by the
483 property flags. Specifically, \l{QAbstractItemView::dragEnabled}
484 {dragEnabled} and \l{QAbstractItemView::acceptDrops}
485 {acceptsDrops} are computed by QListView when calling
486 setMovement() or setViewMode().
487*/
488void QListView::clearPropertyFlags()
489{
490 Q_D(QListView);
491 d->modeProperties = 0;
492}

494/*!
495 Returns \c true if the \a row is hidden; otherwise returns \c false.
496*/
497bool QListView::isRowHidden(int row) const
498{
499 Q_D(const QListView);
500 return d->isHidden(row);
501}
502
503/*!
504 If \a hide is true, the given \a row will be hidden; otherwise
505 the \a row will be shown.
506*/
507void QListView::setRowHidden(int row, bool hide)
508{
509 Q_D(QListView);
510 const bool hidden = d->isHidden(row);
511 if (hide && !hidden)
512 d->commonListView->appendHiddenRow(row);
513 else if (!hide && hidden)
514 d->commonListView->removeHiddenRow(row);
515 d->doDelayedItemsLayout();
516 d->viewport->update();
517}

519/*!
520 \reimp
521*/
522QRect QListView::visualRect(const QModelIndex &index) const
523{
524 Q_D(const QListView);
525 return d->mapToViewport(rect: rectForIndex(index));
526}
527
528/*!
529 \reimp
530*/
531void QListView::scrollTo(const QModelIndex &index, ScrollHint hint)
532{
533 Q_D(QListView);
534
535 if (index.parent() != d->root || index.column() != d->column)
536 return;
537
538 const QRect rect = visualRect(index);
539 if (!rect.isValid())
540 return;
541 if (hint == EnsureVisible && d->viewport->rect().contains(r: rect)) {
542 d->viewport->update(rect);
543 return;
544 }
545
546 if (d->flow == QListView::TopToBottom || d->isWrapping()) // vertical
547 verticalScrollBar()->setValue(d->verticalScrollToValue(index, rect, hint));
548
549 if (d->flow == QListView::LeftToRight || d->isWrapping()) // horizontal
550 horizontalScrollBar()->setValue(d->horizontalScrollToValue(index, rect, hint));
551}
552
553int QListViewPrivate::horizontalScrollToValue(const QModelIndex &index, const QRect &rect,
554 QListView::ScrollHint hint) const
555{
556 Q_Q(const QListView);
557 const QRect area = viewport->rect();
558 const bool leftOf = q->isRightToLeft()
559 ? (rect.left() < area.left()) && (rect.right() < area.right())
560 : rect.left() < area.left();
561 const bool rightOf = q->isRightToLeft()
562 ? rect.right() > area.right()
563 : (rect.right() > area.right()) && (rect.left() > area.left());
564 return commonListView->horizontalScrollToValue(index: q->visualIndex(index), hint, leftOf, rightOf, area, rect);
565}
566
567int QListViewPrivate::verticalScrollToValue(const QModelIndex &index, const QRect &rect,
568 QListView::ScrollHint hint) const
569{
570 Q_Q(const QListView);
571 const QRect area = viewport->rect();
572 const bool above = (hint == QListView::EnsureVisible && rect.top() < area.top());
573 const bool below = (hint == QListView::EnsureVisible && rect.bottom() > area.bottom());
574 return commonListView->verticalScrollToValue(index: q->visualIndex(index), hint, above, below, area, rect);
575}
576
577void QListViewPrivate::selectAll(QItemSelectionModel::SelectionFlags command)
578{
579 if (!selectionModel)
580 return;
581
582 QItemSelection selection;
583 QModelIndex topLeft;
584 int row = 0;
585 const int colCount = model->columnCount(parent: root);
586 for(; row < model->rowCount(parent: root); ++row) {
587 if (isHidden(row)) {
588 //it might be the end of a selection range
589 if (topLeft.isValid()) {
590 QModelIndex bottomRight = model->index(row: row - 1, column: colCount - 1, parent: root);
591 selection.append(t: QItemSelectionRange(topLeft, bottomRight));
592 topLeft = QModelIndex();
593 }
594 continue;
595 }
596
597 if (!topLeft.isValid()) //start of a new selection range
598 topLeft = model->index(row, column: 0, parent: root);
599 }
600
601 if (topLeft.isValid()) {
602 //last selected range
603 QModelIndex bottomRight = model->index(row: row - 1, column: colCount - 1, parent: root);
604 selection.append(t: QItemSelectionRange(topLeft, bottomRight));
605 }
606
607 if (!selection.isEmpty())
608 selectionModel->select(selection, command);
609}
610
611/*!
612 \reimp
613
614 We have a QListView way of knowing what elements are on the viewport
615 through the intersectingSet function
616*/
617QItemViewPaintPairs QListViewPrivate::draggablePaintPairs(const QModelIndexList &indexes, QRect *r) const
618{
619 Q_ASSERT(r);
620 Q_Q(const QListView);
621 QRect &rect = *r;
622 const QRect viewportRect = viewport->rect();
623 QItemViewPaintPairs ret;
624 QList<QModelIndex> visibleIndexes =
625 intersectingSet(area: viewportRect.translated(dx: q->horizontalOffset(), dy: q->verticalOffset()));
626 std::sort(first: visibleIndexes.begin(), last: visibleIndexes.end());
627 for (const auto &index : indexes) {
628 if (std::binary_search(first: visibleIndexes.cbegin(), last: visibleIndexes.cend(), val: index)) {
629 const QRect current = q->visualRect(index);
630 ret.append(t: {.rect: current, .index: index});
631 rect |= current;
632 }
633 }
634 QRect clipped = rect & viewportRect;
635 rect.setLeft(clipped.left());
636 rect.setRight(clipped.right());
637 return ret;
638}

640/*!
641 \internal
642*/
643void QListView::reset()
644{
645 Q_D(QListView);
646 d->clear();
647 d->hiddenRows.clear();
648 QAbstractItemView::reset();
649}

651/*!
652 \reimp
653*/
654void QListView::setRootIndex(const QModelIndex &index)
655{
656 Q_D(QListView);
657 d->column = qMax(a: 0, b: qMin(a: d->column, b: d->model->columnCount(parent: index) - 1));
658 QAbstractItemView::setRootIndex(index);
659 // sometimes we get an update before reset() is called
660 d->clear();
661 d->hiddenRows.clear();
662}

670void QListView::scrollContentsBy(int dx, int dy)

672 Q_D(QListView);

674 d->commonListView->scrollContentsBy(dx, dy, scrollElasticBand: d->state == QListView::DragSelectingState);
675}

708/*!
709 \reimp
710*/
711void QListView::rowsInserted(const QModelIndex &parent, int start, int end)
712{
713 Q_D(QListView);
714 // ### be smarter about inserted items
715 d->clear();
716 d->doDelayedItemsLayout();
717 QAbstractItemView::rowsInserted(parent, start, end);
718}
719
720/*!
721 \reimp
722*/
723void QListView::rowsAboutToBeRemoved(const QModelIndex &parent, int start, int end)
724{
725 Q_D(QListView);
726 // if the parent is above d->root in the tree, nothing will happen
727 QAbstractItemView::rowsAboutToBeRemoved(parent, start, end);
728 if (parent == d->root) {
729 QSet<QPersistentModelIndex>::iterator it = d->hiddenRows.begin();
730 while (it != d->hiddenRows.end()) {
731 int hiddenRow = it->row();
732 if (hiddenRow >= start && hiddenRow <= end) {
733 it = d->hiddenRows.erase(i: it);
734 } else {
735 ++it;
736 }
737 }
738 }
739 d->clear();
740 d->doDelayedItemsLayout();
741}
742
743/*!
744 \reimp
745*/
746void QListView::mouseMoveEvent(QMouseEvent *e)
747{
748 if (!isVisible())
749 return;
750 Q_D(QListView);
751 QAbstractItemView::mouseMoveEvent(event: e);
752 if (state() == DragSelectingState
753 && d->showElasticBand
754 && d->selectionMode != SingleSelection
755 && d->selectionMode != NoSelection) {
756 QRect rect(d->pressedPosition, e->position().toPoint() + QPoint(horizontalOffset(), verticalOffset()));
757 rect = rect.normalized();
758 d->viewport->update(d->mapToViewport(rect: rect.united(r: d->elasticBand)));
759 d->elasticBand = rect;
760 }
761}
762
763/*!
764 \reimp
765*/
766void QListView::mouseReleaseEvent(QMouseEvent *e)
767{
768 Q_D(QListView);
769 QAbstractItemView::mouseReleaseEvent(event: e);
770 // #### move this implementation into a dynamic class
771 if (d->showElasticBand && d->elasticBand.isValid()) {
772 d->viewport->update(d->mapToViewport(rect: d->elasticBand));
773 d->elasticBand = QRect();
774 }
775}
776
777#if QT_CONFIG(wheelevent)
778/*!
779 \reimp
780*/
781void QListView::wheelEvent(QWheelEvent *e)
782{
783 Q_D(QListView);
784 if (qAbs(t: e->angleDelta().y()) > qAbs(t: e->angleDelta().x())) {
785 if (e->angleDelta().x() == 0
786 && ((d->flow == TopToBottom && d->wrap) || (d->flow == LeftToRight && !d->wrap))
787 && d->vbar->minimum() == 0 && d->vbar->maximum() == 0) {
788 QPoint pixelDelta(e->pixelDelta().y(), e->pixelDelta().x());
789 QPoint angleDelta(e->angleDelta().y(), e->angleDelta().x());
790 QWheelEvent hwe(e->position(), e->globalPosition(), pixelDelta, angleDelta,
791 e->buttons(), e->modifiers(), e->phase(), e->inverted(), e->source());
792 if (e->spontaneous())
793 qt_sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: d->hbar, event: &hwe);
794 else
795 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: d->hbar, event: &hwe);
796 e->setAccepted(hwe.isAccepted());
797 } else {
798 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: d->vbar, event: e);
799 }
800 } else {
801 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: d->hbar, event: e);
802 }
803}
804#endif // QT_CONFIG(wheelevent)
805
806/*!
807 \reimp
808*/
809void QListView::timerEvent(QTimerEvent *e)
810{
811 Q_D(QListView);
812 if (e->timerId() == d->batchLayoutTimer.timerId()) {
813 if (d->doItemsLayout(num: d->batchSize)) { // layout is done
814 d->batchLayoutTimer.stop();
815 updateGeometries();
816 d->viewport->update();
817 }
818 }
819 QAbstractItemView::timerEvent(event: e);
820}
821
822/*!
823 \reimp
824*/
825void QListView::resizeEvent(QResizeEvent *e)
826{
827 Q_D(QListView);
828 if (d->delayedPendingLayout)
829 return;
830
831 QSize delta = e->size() - e->oldSize();
832
833 if (delta.isNull())
834 return;
835
836 bool listWrap = (d->viewMode == ListMode) && d->wrapItemText;
837 bool flowDimensionChanged = (d->flow == LeftToRight && delta.width() != 0)
838 || (d->flow == TopToBottom && delta.height() != 0);
839
840 // We post a delayed relayout in the following cases :
841 // - we're wrapping
842 // - the state is NoState, we're adjusting and the size has changed in the flowing direction
843 if (listWrap
844 || (state() == NoState && d->resizeMode == Adjust && flowDimensionChanged)) {
845 d->doDelayedItemsLayout(delay: 100); // wait 1/10 sec before starting the layout
846 } else {
847 QAbstractItemView::resizeEvent(event: e);
848 }
849}
850
851#if QT_CONFIG(draganddrop)

856void QListView::dragMoveEvent(QDragMoveEvent *e)
857{
858 Q_D(QListView);
859 if (!d->commonListView->filterDragMoveEvent(e)) {
860 if (viewMode() == QListView::ListMode && flow() == QListView::LeftToRight)
861 static_cast<QListModeViewBase *>(d->commonListView)->dragMoveEvent(e);
862 else
863 QAbstractItemView::dragMoveEvent(event: e);
864 }
865}

876
877/*!
878 \reimp
879*/
880void QListView::dropEvent(QDropEvent *event)
881{
882 Q_D(QListView);
883
884 if (event->source() == this && (event->dropAction() == Qt::MoveAction ||
885 dragDropMode() == QAbstractItemView::InternalMove)) {
886 QModelIndex topIndex;
887 bool topIndexDropped = false;
888 int col = -1;
889 int row = -1;
890 // check whether a subclass has already accepted the event, ie. moved the data
891 if (!event->isAccepted() && d->dropOn(event, row: &row, col: &col, index: &topIndex)) {
892 const QList<QModelIndex> selIndexes = selectedIndexes();
893 QList<QPersistentModelIndex> persIndexes;
894 persIndexes.reserve(size: selIndexes.size());
895
896 for (const auto &index : selIndexes) {
897 persIndexes.append(t: index);
898 if (index == topIndex) {
899 topIndexDropped = true;
900 break;
901 }
902 }
903
904 if (!topIndexDropped && !topIndex.isValid()) {
905 std::sort(first: persIndexes.begin(), last: persIndexes.end()); // The dropped items will remain in the same visual order.
906
907 QPersistentModelIndex dropRow = model()->index(row, column: col, parent: topIndex);
908
909 int r = row == -1 ? model()->rowCount() : (dropRow.row() >= 0 ? dropRow.row() : row);
910 bool dataMoved = false;
911 for (int i = 0; i < persIndexes.size(); ++i) {
912 const QPersistentModelIndex &pIndex = persIndexes.at(i);
913 if (r != pIndex.row()) {
914 // try to move (preserves selection)
915 dataMoved |= model()->moveRow(sourceParent: QModelIndex(), sourceRow: pIndex.row(), destinationParent: QModelIndex(), destinationChild: r);
916 if (!dataMoved) // can't move - abort and let QAbstractItemView handle this
917 break;
918 } else {
919 // move onto itself is blocked, don't delete anything
920 dataMoved = true;
921 }
922 r = pIndex.row() + 1; // Dropped items are inserted contiguously and in the right order.
923 }
924 if (dataMoved)
925 event->accept();
926 }
927 }
928
929 // either we or a subclass accepted the move event, so assume that the data was
930 // moved and that QAbstractItemView shouldn't remove the source when QDrag::exec returns
931 if (event->isAccepted())
932 d->dropEventMoved = true;
933 }
934
935 if (!d->commonListView->filterDropEvent(event) || !d->dropEventMoved) {
936 // icon view didn't move the data, and moveRows not implemented, so fall back to default
937 if (!d->dropEventMoved)
938 event->ignore();
939 QAbstractItemView::dropEvent(event);
940 }
941}
942
943/*!
944 \reimp
945*/
946void QListView::startDrag(Qt::DropActions supportedActions)
947{
948 if (!d_func()->commonListView->filterStartDrag(supportedActions))
949 QAbstractItemView::startDrag(supportedActions);
950}

952#endif // QT_CONFIG(draganddrop)

954/*!
955 \reimp
956*/
957void QListView::initViewItemOption(QStyleOptionViewItem *option) const
958{
959 Q_D(const QListView);
960 QAbstractItemView::initViewItemOption(option);
961 if (!d->iconSize.isValid()) { // otherwise it was already set in abstractitemview
962 int pm = (d->viewMode == QListView::ListMode
963 ? style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_ListViewIconSize, option: nullptr, widget: this)
964 : style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_IconViewIconSize, option: nullptr, widget: this));
965 option->decorationSize = QSize(pm, pm);
966 }
967 if (d->viewMode == QListView::IconMode) {
968 option->showDecorationSelected = false;
969 option->decorationPosition = QStyleOptionViewItem::Top;
970 option->displayAlignment = Qt::AlignCenter;
971 } else {
972 option->decorationPosition = QStyleOptionViewItem::Left;
973 }
974
975 if (d->gridSize().isValid()) {
976 option->rect.setSize(d->gridSize());
977 }
978}

980
981/*!
982 \reimp
983*/
984void QListView::paintEvent(QPaintEvent *e)
985{
986 Q_D(QListView);
987 if (!d->itemDelegate)
988 return;
989 QStyleOptionViewItem option;
990 initViewItemOption(option: &option);
991 QStylePainter painter(d->viewport);
992
993 const QList<QModelIndex> toBeRendered =
994 d->intersectingSet(area: e->rect().translated(dx: horizontalOffset(), dy: verticalOffset()), doLayout: false);
995
996 const QModelIndex current = currentIndex();
997 const QModelIndex hover = d->hover;
998 const QAbstractItemModel *itemModel = d->model;
999 const QItemSelectionModel *selections = d->selectionModel;
1000 const bool focus = (hasFocus() || d->viewport->hasFocus()) && current.isValid();
1001 const bool alternate = d->alternatingColors;
1002 const QStyle::State state = option.state;
1003 const QAbstractItemView::State viewState = this->state();
1004 const bool enabled = (state & QStyle::State_Enabled) != 0;
1005
1006 bool alternateBase = false;
1007 int previousRow = -2; // trigger the alternateBase adjustment on first pass
1008
1009 int maxSize = (flow() == TopToBottom)
1010 ? qMax(a: viewport()->size().width(), b: d->contentsSize().width()) - 2 * d->spacing()
1011 : qMax(a: viewport()->size().height(), b: d->contentsSize().height()) - 2 * d->spacing();
1012
1013 QList<QModelIndex>::const_iterator end = toBeRendered.constEnd();
1014 for (QList<QModelIndex>::const_iterator it = toBeRendered.constBegin(); it != end; ++it) {
1015 Q_ASSERT((*it).isValid());
1016 option.rect = visualRect(index: *it);
1017
1018 if (flow() == TopToBottom)
1019 option.rect.setWidth(qMin(a: maxSize, b: option.rect.width()));
1020 else
1021 option.rect.setHeight(qMin(a: maxSize, b: option.rect.height()));
1022
1023 option.state = state;
1024 if (selections && selections->isSelected(index: *it))
1025 option.state |= QStyle::State_Selected;
1026 if (enabled) {
1027 QPalette::ColorGroup cg;
1028 if ((itemModel->flags(index: *it) & Qt::ItemIsEnabled) == 0) {
1029 option.state &= ~QStyle::State_Enabled;
1030 cg = QPalette::Disabled;
1031 } else {
1032 cg = QPalette::Normal;
1033 }
1034 option.palette.setCurrentColorGroup(cg);
1035 }
1036 if (focus && current == *it) {
1037 option.state |= QStyle::State_HasFocus;
1038 if (viewState == EditingState)
1039 option.state |= QStyle::State_Editing;
1040 }
1041 option.state.setFlag(flag: QStyle::State_MouseOver, on: *it == hover);
1042
1043 if (alternate) {
1044 int row = (*it).row();
1045 if (row != previousRow + 1) {
1046 // adjust alternateBase according to rows in the "gap"
1047 if (!d->hiddenRows.isEmpty()) {
1048 for (int r = qMax(a: previousRow + 1, b: 0); r < row; ++r) {
1049 if (!d->isHidden(row: r))
1050 alternateBase = !alternateBase;
1051 }
1052 } else {
1053 alternateBase = (row & 1) != 0;
1054 }
1055 }
1056 option.features.setFlag(flag: QStyleOptionViewItem::Alternate, on: alternateBase);
1057
1058 // draw background of the item (only alternate row). rest of the background
1059 // is provided by the delegate
1060 QStyle::State oldState = option.state;
1061 option.state &= ~QStyle::State_Selected;
1062 painter.drawPrimitive(pe: QStyle::PE_PanelItemViewRow, opt: option);
1063 option.state = oldState;
1064
1065 alternateBase = !alternateBase;
1066 previousRow = row;
1067 }
1068
1069 itemDelegateForIndex(index: *it)->paint(painter: &painter, option, index: *it);
1070 }
1071
1072#if QT_CONFIG(draganddrop)
1073 d->commonListView->paintDragDrop(painter: &painter);
1074#endif
1075
1076#if QT_CONFIG(rubberband)
1077 // #### move this implementation into a dynamic class
1078 if (d->showElasticBand && d->elasticBand.isValid()) {
1079 QStyleOptionRubberBand opt;
1080 opt.initFrom(w: this);
1081 opt.shape = QRubberBand::Rectangle;
1082 opt.opaque = false;
1083 opt.rect = d->mapToViewport(rect: d->elasticBand, extend: false).intersected(
1084 other: d->viewport->rect().adjusted(xp1: -16, yp1: -16, xp2: 16, yp2: 16));
1085 painter.save();
1086 painter.drawControl(ce: QStyle::CE_RubberBand, opt);
1087 painter.restore();
1088 }
1089#endif
1090}

1092/*!
1093 \reimp
1094*/
1095QModelIndex QListView::indexAt(const QPoint &p) const
1096{
1097 Q_D(const QListView);
1098 QRect rect(p.x() + horizontalOffset(), p.y() + verticalOffset(), 1, 1);
1099 const QList<QModelIndex> intersectVector = d->intersectingSet(area: rect);
1100 QModelIndex index = intersectVector.size() > 0
1101 ? intersectVector.last() : QModelIndex();
1102 if (index.isValid() && visualRect(index).contains(p))
1103 return index;
1104 return QModelIndex();
1105}

1122
1123/*!
1124 \reimp
1125*/
1126QModelIndex QListView::moveCursor(CursorAction cursorAction, Qt::KeyboardModifiers modifiers)
1127{
1128 Q_D(QListView);
1129 Q_UNUSED(modifiers);
1130
1131 auto findAvailableRowBackward = [d](int row) {
1132 while (row >= 0 && d->isHiddenOrDisabled(row))
1133 --row;
1134 return row;
1135 };
1136
1137 auto findAvailableRowForward = [d](int row) {
1138 int rowCount = d->model->rowCount(parent: d->root);
1139 if (!rowCount)
1140 return -1;
1141 while (row < rowCount && d->isHiddenOrDisabled(row))
1142 ++row;
1143 if (row >= rowCount)
1144 return -1;
1145 return row;
1146 };
1147
1148 QModelIndex current = currentIndex();
1149 if (!current.isValid()) {
1150 int row = findAvailableRowForward(0);
1151 if (row == -1)
1152 return QModelIndex();
1153 return d->model->index(row, column: d->column, parent: d->root);
1154 }
1155
1156 if ((d->flow == LeftToRight && cursorAction == MoveLeft) ||
1157 (d->flow == TopToBottom && (cursorAction == MoveUp || cursorAction == MovePrevious))) {
1158 const int row = findAvailableRowBackward(current.row() - 1);
1159 if (row == -1)
1160 return current;
1161 return d->model->index(row, column: d->column, parent: d->root);
1162 } else if ((d->flow == LeftToRight && cursorAction == MoveRight) ||
1163 (d->flow == TopToBottom && (cursorAction == MoveDown || cursorAction == MoveNext))) {
1164 const int row = findAvailableRowForward(current.row() + 1);
1165 if (row == -1)
1166 return current;
1167 return d->model->index(row, column: d->column, parent: d->root);
1168 }
1169
1170 const QRect initialRect = rectForIndex(index: current);
1171 QRect rect = initialRect;
1172 if (rect.isEmpty()) {
1173 return d->model->index(row: 0, column: d->column, parent: d->root);
1174 }
1175 if (d->gridSize().isValid()) rect.setSize(d->gridSize());
1176
1177 QSize contents = d->contentsSize();
1178 QList<QModelIndex> intersectVector;
1179
1180 switch (cursorAction) {
1181 case MoveLeft:
1182 while (intersectVector.isEmpty()) {
1183 rect.translate(dx: -rect.width(), dy: 0);
1184 if (rect.right() <= 0)
1185 return current;
1186 if (rect.left() < 0)
1187 rect.setLeft(0);
1188 intersectVector = d->intersectingSet(area: rect);
1189 d->removeCurrentAndDisabled(indexes: &intersectVector, current);
1190 }
1191 return d->closestIndex(target: initialRect, candidates: intersectVector);
1192 case MoveRight:
1193 while (intersectVector.isEmpty()) {
1194 rect.translate(dx: rect.width(), dy: 0);
1195 if (rect.left() >= contents.width())
1196 return current;
1197 if (rect.right() > contents.width())
1198 rect.setRight(contents.width());
1199 intersectVector = d->intersectingSet(area: rect);
1200 d->removeCurrentAndDisabled(indexes: &intersectVector, current);
1201 }
1202 return d->closestIndex(target: initialRect, candidates: intersectVector);
1203 case MovePageUp: {
1204 if (rect.height() >= d->viewport->height())
1205 return moveCursor(cursorAction: QAbstractItemView::MoveUp, modifiers);
1206
1207 rect.moveTop(pos: rect.top() - d->viewport->height() + 1);
1208 if (rect.top() < rect.height()) {
1209 rect.setTop(0);
1210 rect.setBottom(1);
1211 }
1212 QModelIndex findindex = current;
1213 while (intersectVector.isEmpty()
1214 || rectForIndex(index: findindex).top() <= (rectForIndex(index: current).bottom() - d->viewport->rect().height())
1215 || rect.top() <= 0) {
1216 rect.translate(dx: 0, dy: 1);
1217 if (rect.bottom() <= 0) {
1218 return current;
1219 }
1220 intersectVector = d->intersectingSet(area: rect);
1221 findindex = d->closestIndex(target: initialRect, candidates: intersectVector);
1222 }
1223 return findindex;
1224 }
1225 case MovePrevious:
1226 case MoveUp:
1227 while (intersectVector.isEmpty()) {
1228 rect.translate(dx: 0, dy: -rect.height());
1229 if (rect.bottom() <= 0) {
1230#ifdef QT_KEYPAD_NAVIGATION
1231 if (QApplicationPrivate::keypadNavigationEnabled()) {
1232 int row = d->batchStartRow() - 1;
1233 while (row >= 0 && d->isHiddenOrDisabled(row))
1234 --row;
1235 if (row >= 0)
1236 return d->model->index(row, d->column, d->root);
1237 }
1238#endif
1239 return current;
1240 }
1241 if (rect.top() < 0)
1242 rect.setTop(0);
1243 intersectVector = d->intersectingSet(area: rect);
1244 d->removeCurrentAndDisabled(indexes: &intersectVector, current);
1245 }
1246 return d->closestIndex(target: initialRect, candidates: intersectVector);
1247 case MovePageDown: {
1248 if (rect.height() >= d->viewport->height())
1249 return moveCursor(cursorAction: QAbstractItemView::MoveDown, modifiers);
1250
1251 rect.moveTop(pos: rect.top() + d->viewport->height() - 1);
1252 if (rect.bottom() > contents.height() - rect.height()) {
1253 rect.setTop(contents.height() - 1);
1254 rect.setBottom(contents.height());
1255 }
1256 QModelIndex index = current;
1257 // index's bottom() - current's top() always <= (d->viewport->rect().height()
1258 while (intersectVector.isEmpty()
1259 || rectForIndex(index).bottom() >= (d->viewport->rect().height() + rectForIndex(index: current).top())
1260 || rect.bottom() > contents.height()) {
1261 rect.translate(dx: 0, dy: -1);
1262 if (rect.top() >= contents.height()) {
1263 return current;
1264 }
1265 intersectVector = d->intersectingSet(area: rect);
1266 index = d->closestIndex(target: initialRect, candidates: intersectVector);
1267 }
1268 return index;
1269 }
1270 case MoveNext:
1271 case MoveDown:
1272 while (intersectVector.isEmpty()) {
1273 rect.translate(dx: 0, dy: rect.height());
1274 if (rect.top() >= contents.height()) {
1275#ifdef QT_KEYPAD_NAVIGATION
1276 if (QApplicationPrivate::keypadNavigationEnabled()) {
1277 int rowCount = d->model->rowCount(d->root);
1278 int row = 0;
1279 while (row < rowCount && d->isHiddenOrDisabled(row))
1280 ++row;
1281 if (row < rowCount)
1282 return d->model->index(row, d->column, d->root);
1283 }
1284#endif
1285 return current;
1286 }
1287 if (rect.bottom() > contents.height())
1288 rect.setBottom(contents.height());
1289 intersectVector = d->intersectingSet(area: rect);
1290 d->removeCurrentAndDisabled(indexes: &intersectVector, current);
1291 }
1292 return d->closestIndex(target: initialRect, candidates: intersectVector);
1293 case MoveHome:
1294 return d->model->index(row: 0, column: d->column, parent: d->root);
1295 case MoveEnd:
1296 return d->model->index(row: d->batchStartRow() - 1, column: d->column, parent: d->root);}
1297
1298 return current;
1299}

1301/*!
1302 Returns the rectangle of the item at position \a index in the
1303 model. The rectangle is in contents coordinates.
1304
1305 \sa visualRect()
1306*/
1307QRect QListView::rectForIndex(const QModelIndex &index) const
1308{
1309 return d_func()->rectForIndex(index);
1310}
1311
1312/*!
1313 \since 4.1
1314
1315 Sets the contents position of the item at \a index in the model to the given
1316 \a position.
1317 If the list view's movement mode is Static or its view mode is ListView,
1318 this function will have no effect.
1319*/
1320void QListView::setPositionForIndex(const QPoint &position, const QModelIndex &index)
1321{
1322 Q_D(QListView);
1323 if (d->movement == Static
1324 || !d->isIndexValid(index)
1325 || index.parent() != d->root
1326 || index.column() != d->column)
1327 return;
1328
1329 d->executePostedLayout();
1330 d->commonListView->setPositionForIndex(position, index);
1331}
1332
1333/*!
1334 \reimp
1335*/
1336void QListView::setSelection(const QRect &rect, QItemSelectionModel::SelectionFlags command)
1337{
1338 Q_D(QListView);
1339 if (!d->selectionModel)
1340 return;
1341
1342 // if we are wrapping, we can only select inside the contents rectangle
1343 int w = qMax(a: d->contentsSize().width(), b: d->viewport->width());
1344 int h = qMax(a: d->contentsSize().height(), b: d->viewport->height());
1345 if (d->wrap && !QRect(0, 0, w, h).intersects(r: rect))
1346 return;
1347
1348 QItemSelection selection;
1349
1350 if (rect.width() == 1 && rect.height() == 1) {
1351 const QList<QModelIndex> intersectVector =
1352 d->intersectingSet(area: rect.translated(dx: horizontalOffset(), dy: verticalOffset()));
1353 QModelIndex tl;
1354 if (!intersectVector.isEmpty())
1355 tl = intersectVector.last(); // special case for mouse press; only select the top item
1356 if (tl.isValid() && d->isIndexEnabled(index: tl))
1357 selection.select(topLeft: tl, bottomRight: tl);
1358 } else {
1359 if (state() == DragSelectingState) { // visual selection mode (rubberband selection)
1360 selection = d->selection(rect: rect.translated(dx: horizontalOffset(), dy: verticalOffset()));
1361 } else { // logical selection mode (key and mouse click selection)
1362 QModelIndex tl, br;
1363 // get the first item
1364 const QRect topLeft(rect.left() + horizontalOffset(), rect.top() + verticalOffset(), 1, 1);
1365 QList<QModelIndex> intersectVector = d->intersectingSet(area: topLeft);
1366 if (!intersectVector.isEmpty())
1367 tl = intersectVector.last();
1368 // get the last item
1369 const QRect bottomRight(rect.right() + horizontalOffset(), rect.bottom() + verticalOffset(), 1, 1);
1370 intersectVector = d->intersectingSet(area: bottomRight);
1371 if (!intersectVector.isEmpty())
1372 br = intersectVector.last();
1373
1374 // get the ranges
1375 if (tl.isValid() && br.isValid()
1376 && d->isIndexEnabled(index: tl)
1377 && d->isIndexEnabled(index: br)) {
1378 QRect first = d->cellRectForIndex(index: tl);
1379 QRect last = d->cellRectForIndex(index: br);
1380 QRect middle;
1381 if (d->flow == LeftToRight) {
1382 QRect &top = first;
1383 QRect &bottom = last;
1384 // if bottom is above top, swap them
1385 if (top.center().y() > bottom.center().y()) {
1386 QRect tmp = top;
1387 top = bottom;
1388 bottom = tmp;
1389 }
1390 // if the rect are on different lines, expand
1391 if (top.top() != bottom.top()) {
1392 // top rectangle
1393 if (isRightToLeft())
1394 top.setLeft(0);
1395 else
1396 top.setRight(contentsSize().width());
1397 // bottom rectangle
1398 if (isRightToLeft())
1399 bottom.setRight(contentsSize().width());
1400 else
1401 bottom.setLeft(0);
1402 } else if (top.left() > bottom.right()) {
1403 if (isRightToLeft())
1404 bottom.setLeft(top.right());
1405 else
1406 bottom.setRight(top.left());
1407 } else {
1408 if (isRightToLeft())
1409 top.setLeft(bottom.right());
1410 else
1411 top.setRight(bottom.left());
1412 }
1413 // middle rectangle
1414 if (top.bottom() < bottom.top()) {
1415 if (gridSize().isValid() && !gridSize().isNull())
1416 middle.setTop(top.top() + gridSize().height());
1417 else
1418 middle.setTop(top.bottom() + 1);
1419 middle.setLeft(qMin(a: top.left(), b: bottom.left()));
1420 middle.setBottom(bottom.top() - 1);
1421 middle.setRight(qMax(a: top.right(), b: bottom.right()));
1422 }
1423 } else { // TopToBottom
1424 QRect &left = first;
1425 QRect &right = last;
1426 if (left.center().x() > right.center().x())
1427 qSwap(value1&: left, value2&: right);
1428
1429 int ch = contentsSize().height();
1430 if (left.left() != right.left()) {
1431 // left rectangle
1432 if (isRightToLeft())
1433 left.setTop(0);
1434 else
1435 left.setBottom(ch);
1436
1437 // top rectangle
1438 if (isRightToLeft())
1439 right.setBottom(ch);
1440 else
1441 right.setTop(0);
1442 // only set middle if the
1443 middle.setTop(0);
1444 middle.setBottom(ch);
1445 if (gridSize().isValid() && !gridSize().isNull())
1446 middle.setLeft(left.left() + gridSize().width());
1447 else
1448 middle.setLeft(left.right() + 1);
1449 middle.setRight(right.left() - 1);
1450 } else if (left.bottom() < right.top()) {
1451 left.setBottom(right.top() - 1);
1452 } else {
1453 right.setBottom(left.top() - 1);
1454 }
1455 }
1456
1457 // do the selections
1458 QItemSelection topSelection = d->selection(rect: first);
1459 QItemSelection middleSelection = d->selection(rect: middle);
1460 QItemSelection bottomSelection = d->selection(rect: last);
1461 // merge
1462 selection.merge(other: topSelection, command: QItemSelectionModel::Select);
1463 selection.merge(other: middleSelection, command: QItemSelectionModel::Select);
1464 selection.merge(other: bottomSelection, command: QItemSelectionModel::Select);
1465 }
1466 }
1467 }
1468
1469 d->selectionModel->select(selection, command);
1470}
1471
1472/*!
1473 \reimp
1474
1475 Since 4.7, the returned region only contains rectangles intersecting
1476 (or included in) the viewport.
1477*/
1478QRegion QListView::visualRegionForSelection(const QItemSelection &selection) const
1479{
1480 Q_D(const QListView);
1481 // ### NOTE: this is a potential bottleneck in non-static mode
1482 int c = d->column;
1483 QRegion selectionRegion;
1484 const QRect &viewportRect = d->viewport->rect();
1485 for (const auto &elem : selection) {
1486 if (!elem.isValid())
1487 continue;
1488 QModelIndex parent = elem.topLeft().parent();
1489 //we only display the children of the root in a listview
1490 //we're not interested in the other model indexes
1491 if (parent != d->root)
1492 continue;
1493 int t = elem.topLeft().row();
1494 int b = elem.bottomRight().row();
1495 if (d->viewMode == IconMode || d->isWrapping()) { // in non-static mode, we have to go through all selected items
1496 for (int r = t; r <= b; ++r) {
1497 const QRect &rect = visualRect(index: d->model->index(row: r, column: c, parent));
1498 if (viewportRect.intersects(r: rect))
1499 selectionRegion += rect;
1500 }
1501 } else { // in static mode, we can optimize a bit
1502 while (t <= b && d->isHidden(row: t)) ++t;
1503 while (b >= t && d->isHidden(row: b)) --b;
1504 const QModelIndex top = d->model->index(row: t, column: c, parent);
1505 const QModelIndex bottom = d->model->index(row: b, column: c, parent);
1506 QRect rect(visualRect(index: top).topLeft(),
1507 visualRect(index: bottom).bottomRight());
1508 if (viewportRect.intersects(r: rect))
1509 selectionRegion += rect;
1510 }
1511 }
1512
1513 return selectionRegion;
1514}
1515
1516/*!
1517 \reimp
1518*/
1519QModelIndexList QListView::selectedIndexes() const
1520{
1521 Q_D(const QListView);
1522 if (!d->selectionModel)
1523 return QModelIndexList();
1524
1525 QModelIndexList viewSelected = d->selectionModel->selectedIndexes();
1526 auto ignorable = [this, d](const QModelIndex &index) {
1527 return index.column() != d->column || index.parent() != d->root || isIndexHidden(index);
1528 };
1529 viewSelected.removeIf(pred: ignorable);
1530 return viewSelected;
1531}
1532
1533/*!
1534 \internal
1535
1536 Layout the items according to the flow and wrapping properties.
1537*/
1538void QListView::doItemsLayout()
1539{
1540 Q_D(QListView);
1541 // showing the scroll bars will trigger a resize event,
1542 // so we set the state to expanding to avoid
1543 // triggering another layout
1544 QAbstractItemView::State oldState = state();
1545 setState(ExpandingState);
1546 if (d->model->columnCount(parent: d->root) > 0) { // no columns means no contents
1547 d->resetBatchStartRow();
1548 if (layoutMode() == SinglePass) {
1549 d->doItemsLayout(num: d->model->rowCount(parent: d->root)); // layout everything
1550 } else if (!d->batchLayoutTimer.isActive()) {
1551 if (!d->doItemsLayout(num: d->batchSize)) // layout is done
1552 d->batchLayoutTimer.start(msec: 0, obj: this); // do a new batch as fast as possible
1553 }
1554 } else { // clear the QBspTree generated by the last layout
1555 d->clear();
1556 }
1557 QAbstractItemView::doItemsLayout();
1558 setState(oldState); // restoring the oldState
1559}
1560
1561/*!
1562 \reimp
1563*/
1564void QListView::updateGeometries()
1565{
1566 Q_D(QListView);
1567 if (geometry().isEmpty() || d->model->rowCount(parent: d->root) <= 0 || d->model->columnCount(parent: d->root) <= 0) {
1568 horizontalScrollBar()->setRange(min: 0, max: 0);
1569 verticalScrollBar()->setRange(min: 0, max: 0);
1570 } else {
1571 QModelIndex index = d->model->index(row: 0, column: d->column, parent: d->root);
1572 QStyleOptionViewItem option;
1573 initViewItemOption(option: &option);
1574 QSize step = d->itemSize(option, index);
1575 d->commonListView->updateHorizontalScrollBar(step);
1576 d->commonListView->updateVerticalScrollBar(step);
1577 }
1578
1579 QAbstractItemView::updateGeometries();
1580
1581 // if the scroll bars are turned off, we resize the contents to the viewport
1582 if (d->movement == Static && !d->isWrapping()) {
1583 d->layoutChildren(); // we need the viewport size to be updated
1584 if (d->flow == TopToBottom) {
1585 if (horizontalScrollBarPolicy() == Qt::ScrollBarAlwaysOff) {
1586 d->setContentsSize(w: viewport()->width(), h: contentsSize().height());
1587 horizontalScrollBar()->setRange(min: 0, max: 0); // we see all the contents anyway
1588 }
1589 } else { // LeftToRight
1590 if (verticalScrollBarPolicy() == Qt::ScrollBarAlwaysOff) {
1591 d->setContentsSize(w: contentsSize().width(), h: viewport()->height());
1592 verticalScrollBar()->setRange(min: 0, max: 0); // we see all the contents anyway
1593 }
1594 }
1595 }
1596
1597}

1603{
1604 Q_D(const QListView);

1606 && (index.parent() == d->root)
1607 && index.column() == d->column);

1661 necessary at word-breaks; otherwise it is not wrapped at all.

1777 cachedItemSize = QSize();
1778 commonListView->clear();

1780
1781void QListViewPrivate::prepareItemsLayout()
1782{
1783 Q_Q(QListView);
1784 clear();
1785
1786 //take the size as if there were scrollbar in order to prevent scrollbar to blink
1787 layoutBounds = QRect(QPoint(), q->maximumViewportSize());
1788
1789 int frameAroundContents = 0;
1790 if (q->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_ScrollView_FrameOnlyAroundContents)) {
1791 QStyleOption option;
1792 option.initFrom(w: q);
1793 frameAroundContents = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_DefaultFrameWidth, option: &option) * 2;
1794 }
1795
1796 // maximumViewportSize() already takes scrollbar into account if policy is
1797 // Qt::ScrollBarAlwaysOn but scrollbar extent must be deduced if policy
1798 // is Qt::ScrollBarAsNeeded
1799 int verticalMargin = (vbarpolicy == Qt::ScrollBarAsNeeded) && (flow == QListView::LeftToRight || vbar->isVisible())
1800 && !q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_ScrollView_ScrollBarOverlap, option: nullptr, widget: vbar)
1801 ? q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_ScrollBarExtent, option: nullptr, widget: vbar) + frameAroundContents
1802 : 0;
1803 int horizontalMargin = hbarpolicy==Qt::ScrollBarAsNeeded
1804 ? q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_ScrollBarExtent, option: nullptr, widget: hbar) + frameAroundContents
1805 : 0;
1806
1807 layoutBounds.adjust(dx1: 0, dy1: 0, dx2: -verticalMargin, dy2: -horizontalMargin);
1808
1809 int rowCount = model->columnCount(parent: root) <= 0 ? 0 : model->rowCount(parent: root);
1810 commonListView->setRowCount(rowCount);
1811}
1812
1813/*!
1814 \internal
1815*/
1816bool QListViewPrivate::doItemsLayout(int delta)
1817{
1818 int max = model->rowCount(parent: root) - 1;
1819 int first = batchStartRow();
1820 int last = qMin(a: first + delta - 1, b: max);
1821
1822 if (first == 0) {
1823 layoutChildren(); // make sure the viewport has the right size
1824 prepareItemsLayout();
1825 }
1826
1827 if (max < 0 || last < first) {
1828 return true; // nothing to do
1829 }
1830
1831 QListViewLayoutInfo info;
1832 info.bounds = layoutBounds;
1833 info.grid = gridSize();
1834 info.spacing = (info.grid.isValid() ? 0 : spacing());
1835 info.first = first;
1836 info.last = last;
1837 info.wrap = isWrapping();
1838 info.flow = flow;
1839 info.max = max;
1840
1841 return commonListView->doBatchedItemLayout(info, max);
1842}
1843
1844QListViewItem QListViewPrivate::indexToListViewItem(const QModelIndex &index) const
1845{
1846 if (!index.isValid() || isHidden(row: index.row()))
1847 return QListViewItem();
1848
1849 return commonListView->indexToListViewItem(index);
1850}
1851
1852QRect QListViewPrivate::mapToViewport(const QRect &rect, bool extend) const
1853{
1854 Q_Q(const QListView);
1855 if (!rect.isValid())
1856 return rect;
1857
1858 QRect result = extend ? commonListView->mapToViewport(rect) : rect;
1859 int dx = -q->horizontalOffset();
1860 int dy = -q->verticalOffset();
1861 return result.adjusted(xp1: dx, yp1: dy, xp2: dx, yp2: dy);
1862}
1863
1864QModelIndex QListViewPrivate::closestIndex(const QRect &target,
1865 const QList<QModelIndex> &candidates) const
1866{
1867 int distance = 0;
1868 int shortest = INT_MAX;
1869 QModelIndex closest;
1870 QList<QModelIndex>::const_iterator it = candidates.begin();
1871
1872 for (; it != candidates.end(); ++it) {
1873 if (!(*it).isValid())
1874 continue;
1875
1876 const QRect indexRect = indexToListViewItem(index: *it).rect();
1877
1878 //if the center x (or y) position of an item is included in the rect of the other item,
1879 //we define the distance between them as the difference in x (or y) of their respective center.
1880 // Otherwise, we use the nahattan length between the 2 items
1881 if ((target.center().x() >= indexRect.x() && target.center().x() < indexRect.right())
1882 || (indexRect.center().x() >= target.x() && indexRect.center().x() < target.right())) {
1883 //one item's center is at the vertical of the other
1884 distance = qAbs(t: indexRect.center().y() - target.center().y());
1885 } else if ((target.center().y() >= indexRect.y() && target.center().y() < indexRect.bottom())
1886 || (indexRect.center().y() >= target.y() && indexRect.center().y() < target.bottom())) {
1887 //one item's center is at the vertical of the other
1888 distance = qAbs(t: indexRect.center().x() - target.center().x());
1889 } else {
1890 distance = (indexRect.center() - target.center()).manhattanLength();
1891 }
1892 if (distance < shortest) {
1893 shortest = distance;
1894 closest = *it;
1895 }
1896 }
1897 return closest;
1898}
1899
1900QSize QListViewPrivate::itemSize(const QStyleOptionViewItem &option, const QModelIndex &index) const
1901{
1902 Q_Q(const QListView);
1903 if (!uniformItemSizes) {
1904 const QAbstractItemDelegate *delegate = q->itemDelegateForIndex(index);
1905 return delegate ? delegate->sizeHint(option, index) : QSize();
1906 }
1907 if (!cachedItemSize.isValid()) { // the last item is probably the largest, so we use its size
1908 int row = model->rowCount(parent: root) - 1;
1909 QModelIndex sample = model->index(row, column, parent: root);
1910 const QAbstractItemDelegate *delegate = q->itemDelegateForIndex(index: sample);
1911 cachedItemSize = delegate ? delegate->sizeHint(option, index: sample) : QSize();
1912 }
1913 return cachedItemSize;
1914}
1915
1916QItemSelection QListViewPrivate::selection(const QRect &rect) const
1917{
1918 QItemSelection selection;
1919 QModelIndex tl, br;
1920 const QList<QModelIndex> intersectVector = intersectingSet(area: rect);
1921 QList<QModelIndex>::const_iterator it = intersectVector.begin();
1922 for (; it != intersectVector.end(); ++it) {
1923 if (!tl.isValid() && !br.isValid()) {
1924 tl = br = *it;
1925 } else if ((*it).row() == (tl.row() - 1)) {
1926 tl = *it; // expand current range
1927 } else if ((*it).row() == (br.row() + 1)) {
1928 br = (*it); // expand current range
1929 } else {
1930 selection.select(topLeft: tl, bottomRight: br); // select current range
1931 tl = br = *it; // start new range
1932 }
1933 }
1934
1935 if (tl.isValid() && br.isValid())
1936 selection.select(topLeft: tl, bottomRight: br);
1937 else if (tl.isValid())
1938 selection.select(topLeft: tl, bottomRight: tl);
1939 else if (br.isValid())
1940 selection.select(topLeft: br, bottomRight: br);
1941
1942 return selection;
1943}

1999
2000void QCommonListViewBase::updateHorizontalScrollBar(const QSize &step)
2001{
2002 horizontalScrollBar()->d_func()->itemviewChangeSingleStep(step: step.width() + spacing());
2003 horizontalScrollBar()->setPageStep(viewport()->width());
2004
2005 // If both scroll bars are set to auto, we might end up in a situation with enough space
2006 // for the actual content. But still one of the scroll bars will become enabled due to
2007 // the other one using the space. The other one will become invisible in the same cycle.
2008 // -> Infinite loop, QTBUG-39902
2009 const bool bothScrollBarsAuto = qq->verticalScrollBarPolicy() == Qt::ScrollBarAsNeeded &&
2010 qq->horizontalScrollBarPolicy() == Qt::ScrollBarAsNeeded;
2011
2012 const QSize viewportSize = QListModeViewBase::viewportSize(v: qq);
2013
2014 bool verticalWantsToShow = contentsSize.height() > viewportSize.height();
2015 bool horizontalWantsToShow;
2016 if (verticalWantsToShow)
2017 horizontalWantsToShow = contentsSize.width() > viewportSize.width() - qq->verticalScrollBar()->width();
2018 else
2019 horizontalWantsToShow = contentsSize.width() > viewportSize.width();
2020
2021 if (bothScrollBarsAuto && !horizontalWantsToShow) {
2022 // break the infinite loop described above by setting the range to 0, 0.
2023 // QAbstractScrollArea will then hide the scroll bar for us
2024 horizontalScrollBar()->setRange(min: 0, max: 0);
2025 } else {
2026 horizontalScrollBar()->setRange(min: 0, max: contentsSize.width() - viewport()->width());
2027 }
2028}
2029
2030void QCommonListViewBase::updateVerticalScrollBar(const QSize &step)
2031{
2032 verticalScrollBar()->d_func()->itemviewChangeSingleStep(step: step.height() + spacing());
2033 verticalScrollBar()->setPageStep(viewport()->height());
2034
2035 // If both scroll bars are set to auto, we might end up in a situation with enough space
2036 // for the actual content. But still one of the scroll bars will become enabled due to
2037 // the other one using the space. The other one will become invisible in the same cycle.
2038 // -> Infinite loop, QTBUG-39902
2039 const bool bothScrollBarsAuto = qq->verticalScrollBarPolicy() == Qt::ScrollBarAsNeeded &&
2040 qq->horizontalScrollBarPolicy() == Qt::ScrollBarAsNeeded;
2041
2042 const QSize viewportSize = QListModeViewBase::viewportSize(v: qq);
2043
2044 bool horizontalWantsToShow = contentsSize.width() > viewportSize.width();
2045 bool verticalWantsToShow;
2046 if (horizontalWantsToShow)
2047 verticalWantsToShow = contentsSize.height() > viewportSize.height() - qq->horizontalScrollBar()->height();
2048 else
2049 verticalWantsToShow = contentsSize.height() > viewportSize.height();
2050
2051 if (bothScrollBarsAuto && !verticalWantsToShow) {
2052 // break the infinite loop described above by setting the range to 0, 0.
2053 // QAbstractScrollArea will then hide the scroll bar for us
2054 verticalScrollBar()->setRange(min: 0, max: 0);
2055 } else {
2056 verticalScrollBar()->setRange(min: 0, max: contentsSize.height() - viewport()->height());
2057 }
2058}
2059
2060void QCommonListViewBase::scrollContentsBy(int dx, int dy, bool /*scrollElasticBand*/)
2061{
2062 dd->scrollContentsBy(dx: isRightToLeft() ? -dx : dx, dy);
2063}
2064
2065int QCommonListViewBase::verticalScrollToValue(int /*index*/, QListView::ScrollHint hint,
2066 bool above, bool below, const QRect &area, const QRect &rect) const
2067{
2068 int verticalValue = verticalScrollBar()->value();
2069 QRect adjusted = rect.adjusted(xp1: -spacing(), yp1: -spacing(), xp2: spacing(), yp2: spacing());
2070 if (hint == QListView::PositionAtTop || above)
2071 verticalValue += adjusted.top();
2072 else if (hint == QListView::PositionAtBottom || below)
2073 verticalValue += qMin(a: adjusted.top(), b: adjusted.bottom() - area.height() + 1);
2074 else if (hint == QListView::PositionAtCenter)
2075 verticalValue += adjusted.top() - ((area.height() - adjusted.height()) / 2);
2076 return verticalValue;
2077}
2078
2079int QCommonListViewBase::horizontalOffset() const
2080{
2081 return (isRightToLeft() ? horizontalScrollBar()->maximum() - horizontalScrollBar()->value() : horizontalScrollBar()->value());
2082}
2083
2084int QCommonListViewBase::horizontalScrollToValue(const int /*index*/, QListView::ScrollHint hint,
2085 bool leftOf, bool rightOf, const QRect &area, const QRect &rect) const
2086{
2087 int horizontalValue = horizontalScrollBar()->value();
2088 if (isRightToLeft()) {
2089 if (hint == QListView::PositionAtCenter) {
2090 horizontalValue += ((area.width() - rect.width()) / 2) - rect.left();
2091 } else {
2092 if (leftOf)
2093 horizontalValue -= rect.left();
2094 else if (rightOf)
2095 horizontalValue += qMin(a: rect.left(), b: area.width() - rect.right());
2096 }
2097 } else {
2098 if (hint == QListView::PositionAtCenter) {
2099 horizontalValue += rect.left() - ((area.width()- rect.width()) / 2);
2100 } else {
2101 if (leftOf)
2102 horizontalValue += rect.left();
2103 else if (rightOf)
2104 horizontalValue += qMin(a: rect.left(), b: rect.right() - area.width());
2105 }
2106 }
2107 return horizontalValue;
2108}

2121#if QT_CONFIG(draganddrop)
2122QAbstractItemView::DropIndicatorPosition QListModeViewBase::position(const QPoint &pos, const QRect &rect, const QModelIndex &index) const
2123{
2124 QAbstractItemView::DropIndicatorPosition r = QAbstractItemView::OnViewport;
2125 if (!dd->overwrite) {
2126 const int margin = 2;
2127 if (pos.x() - rect.left() < margin) {
2128 r = QAbstractItemView::AboveItem; // Visually, on the left
2129 } else if (rect.right() - pos.x() < margin) {
2130 r = QAbstractItemView::BelowItem; // Visually, on the right
2131 } else if (rect.contains(p: pos, proper: true)) {
2132 r = QAbstractItemView::OnItem;
2133 }
2134 } else {
2135 QRect touchingRect = rect;
2136 touchingRect.adjust(dx1: -1, dy1: -1, dx2: 1, dy2: 1);
2137 if (touchingRect.contains(p: pos, proper: false)) {
2138 r = QAbstractItemView::OnItem;
2139 }
2140 }
2141
2142 if (r == QAbstractItemView::OnItem && (!(dd->model->flags(index) & Qt::ItemIsDropEnabled)))
2143 r = pos.x() < rect.center().x() ? QAbstractItemView::AboveItem : QAbstractItemView::BelowItem;
2144
2145 return r;
2146}
2147
2148void QListModeViewBase::dragMoveEvent(QDragMoveEvent *event)
2149{
2150 if (qq->dragDropMode() == QAbstractItemView::InternalMove
2151 && (event->source() != qq || !(event->possibleActions() & Qt::MoveAction)))
2152 return;
2153
2154 // ignore by default
2155 event->ignore();
2156
2157 // can't use indexAt, doesn't account for spacing.
2158 QPoint p = event->position().toPoint();
2159 QRect rect(p.x() + horizontalOffset(), p.y() + verticalOffset(), 1, 1);
2160 rect.adjust(dx1: -dd->spacing(), dy1: -dd->spacing(), dx2: dd->spacing(), dy2: dd->spacing());
2161 const QList<QModelIndex> intersectVector = dd->intersectingSet(area: rect);
2162 QModelIndex index = intersectVector.size() > 0
2163 ? intersectVector.last() : QModelIndex();
2164 dd->hover = index;
2165 if (!dd->droppingOnItself(event, index)
2166 && dd->canDrop(event)) {
2167
2168 if (index.isValid() && dd->showDropIndicator) {
2169 QRect rect = qq->visualRect(index);
2170 dd->dropIndicatorPosition = position(pos: event->position().toPoint(), rect, index);
2171 // if spacing, should try to draw between items, not just next to item.
2172 switch (dd->dropIndicatorPosition) {
2173 case QAbstractItemView::AboveItem:
2174 if (dd->isIndexDropEnabled(index: index.parent())) {
2175 dd->dropIndicatorRect = QRect(rect.left()-dd->spacing(), rect.top(), 0, rect.height());
2176 event->accept();
2177 } else {
2178 dd->dropIndicatorRect = QRect();
2179 }
2180 break;
2181 case QAbstractItemView::BelowItem:
2182 if (dd->isIndexDropEnabled(index: index.parent())) {
2183 dd->dropIndicatorRect = QRect(rect.right()+dd->spacing(), rect.top(), 0, rect.height());
2184 event->accept();
2185 } else {
2186 dd->dropIndicatorRect = QRect();
2187 }
2188 break;
2189 case QAbstractItemView::OnItem:
2190 if (dd->isIndexDropEnabled(index)) {
2191 dd->dropIndicatorRect = rect;
2192 event->accept();
2193 } else {
2194 dd->dropIndicatorRect = QRect();
2195 }
2196 break;
2197 case QAbstractItemView::OnViewport:
2198 dd->dropIndicatorRect = QRect();
2199 if (dd->isIndexDropEnabled(index: qq->rootIndex())) {
2200 event->accept(); // allow dropping in empty areas
2201 }
2202 break;
2203 }
2204 } else {
2205 dd->dropIndicatorRect = QRect();
2206 dd->dropIndicatorPosition = QAbstractItemView::OnViewport;
2207 if (dd->isIndexDropEnabled(index: qq->rootIndex())) {
2208 event->accept(); // allow dropping in empty areas
2209 }
2210 }
2211 dd->viewport->update();
2212 } // can drop
2213
2214 if (dd->shouldAutoScroll(pos: event->position().toPoint()))
2215 qq->startAutoScroll();
2216}
2217
2218/*!
2219 If the event hasn't already been accepted, determines the index to drop on.
2220
2221 if (row == -1 && col == -1)
2222 // append to this drop index
2223 else
2224 // place at row, col in drop index
2225
2226 If it returns \c true a drop can be done, and dropRow, dropCol and dropIndex reflects the position of the drop.
2227 \internal
2228 */
2229bool QListModeViewBase::dropOn(QDropEvent *event, int *dropRow, int *dropCol, QModelIndex *dropIndex)
2230{
2231 if (event->isAccepted())
2232 return false;
2233
2234 QModelIndex index;
2235 if (dd->viewport->rect().contains(p: event->position().toPoint())) {
2236 // can't use indexAt, doesn't account for spacing.
2237 QPoint p = event->position().toPoint();
2238 QRect rect(p.x() + horizontalOffset(), p.y() + verticalOffset(), 1, 1);
2239 rect.adjust(dx1: -dd->spacing(), dy1: -dd->spacing(), dx2: dd->spacing(), dy2: dd->spacing());
2240 const QList<QModelIndex> intersectVector = dd->intersectingSet(area: rect);
2241 index = intersectVector.size() > 0
2242 ? intersectVector.last() : QModelIndex();
2243 if (!index.isValid())
2244 index = dd->root;
2245 }
2246
2247 // If we are allowed to do the drop
2248 if (dd->model->supportedDropActions() & event->dropAction()) {
2249 int row = -1;
2250 int col = -1;
2251 if (index != dd->root) {
2252 dd->dropIndicatorPosition = position(pos: event->position().toPoint(), rect: qq->visualRect(index), index);
2253 switch (dd->dropIndicatorPosition) {
2254 case QAbstractItemView::AboveItem:
2255 row = index.row();
2256 col = index.column();
2257 index = index.parent();
2258 break;
2259 case QAbstractItemView::BelowItem:
2260 row = index.row() + 1;
2261 col = index.column();
2262 index = index.parent();
2263 break;
2264 case QAbstractItemView::OnItem:
2265 case QAbstractItemView::OnViewport:
2266 break;
2267 }
2268 } else {
2269 dd->dropIndicatorPosition = QAbstractItemView::OnViewport;
2270 }
2271 *dropIndex = index;
2272 *dropRow = row;
2273 *dropCol = col;
2274 if (!dd->droppingOnItself(event, index))
2275 return true;
2276 }
2277 return false;
2278}

2280#endif //QT_CONFIG(draganddrop)

2292 verticalScrollBar()->setRange(min: 0, max: steps - pageSteps);

2294 verticalScrollBar()->setRange(min: 0, max: 0);
2295 }
2296 // } else if (vertical && d->isWrapping() && d->movement == Static) {

2321
2322int QListModeViewBase::verticalScrollToValue(int index, QListView::ScrollHint hint,
2323 bool above, bool below, const QRect &area, const QRect &rect) const
2324{
2325 if (verticalScrollMode() == QAbstractItemView::ScrollPerItem) {
2326 int value;
2327 if (scrollValueMap.isEmpty()) {
2328 value = 0;
2329 } else {
2330 int scrollBarValue = verticalScrollBar()->value();
2331 int numHidden = 0;
2332 for (const auto &idx : std::as_const(t&: dd->hiddenRows))
2333 if (idx.row() <= scrollBarValue)
2334 ++numHidden;
2335 value = qBound(min: 0, val: scrollValueMap.at(i: verticalScrollBar()->value()) - numHidden, max: flowPositions.size() - 1);
2336 }
2337 if (above)
2338 hint = QListView::PositionAtTop;
2339 else if (below)
2340 hint = QListView::PositionAtBottom;
2341 if (hint == QListView::EnsureVisible)
2342 return value;
2343
2344 return perItemScrollToValue(index, value, height: area.height(), hint, orientation: Qt::Vertical, wrap: isWrapping(), extent: rect.height());
2345 }
2346
2347 return QCommonListViewBase::verticalScrollToValue(index, hint, above, below, area, rect);
2348}

2350int QListModeViewBase::horizontalOffset() const
2351{
2352 if (horizontalScrollMode() == QAbstractItemView::ScrollPerItem) {
2353 if (isWrapping()) {
2354 if (flow() == QListView::TopToBottom && !segmentPositions.isEmpty()) {
2355 const int max = segmentPositions.size() - 1;
2356 int currentValue = qBound(min: 0, val: horizontalScrollBar()->value(), max);
2357 int position = segmentPositions.at(i: currentValue);
2358 int maximumValue = qBound(min: 0, val: horizontalScrollBar()->maximum(), max);
2359 int maximum = segmentPositions.at(i: maximumValue);
2360 return (isRightToLeft() ? maximum - position : position);
2361 }
2362 } else if (flow() == QListView::LeftToRight && !flowPositions.isEmpty()) {
2363 int position = flowPositions.at(i: scrollValueMap.at(i: horizontalScrollBar()->value()));
2364 int maximum = flowPositions.at(i: scrollValueMap.at(i: horizontalScrollBar()->maximum()));
2365 return (isRightToLeft() ? maximum - position : position);
2366 }
2367 }
2368 return QCommonListViewBase::horizontalOffset();
2369}
2370
2371int QListModeViewBase::verticalOffset() const
2372{
2373 if (verticalScrollMode() == QAbstractItemView::ScrollPerItem) {
2374 if (isWrapping()) {
2375 if (flow() == QListView::LeftToRight && !segmentPositions.isEmpty()) {
2376 int value = verticalScrollBar()->value();
2377 if (value >= segmentPositions.size())
2378 return 0;
2379 return segmentPositions.at(i: value) - spacing();
2380 }
2381 } else if (flow() == QListView::TopToBottom && !flowPositions.isEmpty()) {
2382 int value = verticalScrollBar()->value();
2383 if (value > scrollValueMap.size())
2384 return 0;
2385 return flowPositions.at(i: scrollValueMap.at(i: value)) - spacing();
2386 }
2387 }
2388 return QCommonListViewBase::verticalOffset();
2389}

2391int QListModeViewBase::horizontalScrollToValue(int index, QListView::ScrollHint hint,
2392 bool leftOf, bool rightOf, const QRect &area, const QRect &rect) const
2393{
2394 if (horizontalScrollMode() != QAbstractItemView::ScrollPerItem)
2395 return QCommonListViewBase::horizontalScrollToValue(index, hint, leftOf, rightOf, area, rect);

2398 if (scrollValueMap.isEmpty())
2399 value = 0;
2400 else
2401 value = qBound(min: 0, val: scrollValueMap.at(i: horizontalScrollBar()->value()), max: flowPositions.size() - 1);
2402 if (leftOf)
2403 hint = QListView::PositionAtTop;
2404 else if (rightOf)
2405 hint = QListView::PositionAtBottom;
2406 if (hint == QListView::EnsureVisible)
2407 return value;
2408
2409 return perItemScrollToValue(index, value, height: area.width(), hint, orientation: Qt::Horizontal, wrap: isWrapping(), extent: rect.width());

2411
2412void QListModeViewBase::scrollContentsBy(int dx, int dy, bool scrollElasticBand)
2413{
2414 // ### reorder this logic
2415 const int verticalValue = verticalScrollBar()->value();
2416 const int horizontalValue = horizontalScrollBar()->value();
2417 const bool vertical = (verticalScrollMode() == QAbstractItemView::ScrollPerItem);
2418 const bool horizontal = (horizontalScrollMode() == QAbstractItemView::ScrollPerItem);
2419
2420 if (isWrapping()) {
2421 if (segmentPositions.isEmpty())
2422 return;
2423 const int max = segmentPositions.size() - 1;
2424 if (horizontal && flow() == QListView::TopToBottom && dx != 0) {
2425 int currentValue = qBound(min: 0, val: horizontalValue, max);
2426 int previousValue = qBound(min: 0, val: currentValue + dx, max);
2427 int currentCoordinate = segmentPositions.at(i: currentValue) - spacing();
2428 int previousCoordinate = segmentPositions.at(i: previousValue) - spacing();
2429 dx = previousCoordinate - currentCoordinate;
2430 } else if (vertical && flow() == QListView::LeftToRight && dy != 0) {
2431 int currentValue = qBound(min: 0, val: verticalValue, max);
2432 int previousValue = qBound(min: 0, val: currentValue + dy, max);
2433 int currentCoordinate = segmentPositions.at(i: currentValue) - spacing();
2434 int previousCoordinate = segmentPositions.at(i: previousValue) - spacing();
2435 dy = previousCoordinate - currentCoordinate;
2436 }
2437 } else {
2438 if (flowPositions.isEmpty())
2439 return;
2440 const int max = scrollValueMap.size() - 1;
2441 if (vertical && flow() == QListView::TopToBottom && dy != 0) {
2442 int currentValue = qBound(min: 0, val: verticalValue, max);
2443 int previousValue = qBound(min: 0, val: currentValue + dy, max);
2444 int currentCoordinate = flowPositions.at(i: scrollValueMap.at(i: currentValue));
2445 int previousCoordinate = flowPositions.at(i: scrollValueMap.at(i: previousValue));
2446 dy = previousCoordinate - currentCoordinate;
2447 } else if (horizontal && flow() == QListView::LeftToRight && dx != 0) {
2448 int currentValue = qBound(min: 0, val: horizontalValue, max);
2449 int previousValue = qBound(min: 0, val: currentValue + dx, max);
2450 int currentCoordinate = flowPositions.at(i: scrollValueMap.at(i: currentValue));
2451 int previousCoordinate = flowPositions.at(i: scrollValueMap.at(i: previousValue));
2452 dx = previousCoordinate - currentCoordinate;
2453 }
2454 }
2455 QCommonListViewBase::scrollContentsBy(dx, dy, scrollElasticBand);
2456}
